intro: Dichrocephala lyrata, commonly known as the lyreleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, creating a distinctive lyre-shaped appearance. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Dichrocephala lyrata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
